frameDefinitions: This frame involves a Donor transferring a Theme to a Recipient.

A less-powerful person or group of people (the Activists) engages in an activity aimed to inconvenience or weaken a more powerful person or group (the Institution) to seek redress, in the form of a series of Demands, for the wrondgoings committed by the Instituion.  '
A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.
These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
An Agent finishes an Activity, which can no longer logically continue.
frameExamples: The workers were <t>striking</t> for better wages and better benefits.
The <t>ratification</t> of the Kyoto protocol has been a long, hard slog.
I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
Jason <t>completed</t> grading the papers late Sunday night.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme.
The object that changes ownership.
The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient.
The <fen>Donor</fen> and <fen>Recipient</fen> conceived of as a unit.
When the transfer occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The person or group of people that act out against the <fen>Institution</fen> in an attempt to have their <fen>Demands</fen> fullfilled.
The <fen>Institution</fen> is the company, factory, political party / institution, or entity that yields authority over the <fen>Activists</fen>.

The <fen>Demands</fen> are the guarantee(s) given by the <fen>Institution</fen> to the <fen>Activists</fen> that act to correct or address the issues or state of affairs that were grievous to the <fen>Activists</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the location where the political action occurs.

The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Ratifier</fen> ratifies the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.
This role identifies the <fen>Agent</fen> who has finished an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> has finished.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> finishes.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> finishes the <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: If <fex>we</fex> ratify Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !
President Aleksander Kwasniewski ratified <fex>protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.
The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
<fex>Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> baptized their son.
